latestAction.text: Received in the Senate and Read twice and referred to the Committee on Agriculture, Nutrition, and Forestry.

item.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 243 - 182 (Roll no. 274). (text: CR H3773-3774)
Passed/agreed to in House: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 243 - 182 (Roll no. 274).(text: CR H3773-3774)
The previous question was ordered without objection. (consideration: CR H3780)
DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 288.
Considered as privileged matter. (consideration: CR H3773-3781)
Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 37.

Resolution provides authority for the Committee on Appropriations to have until 5 p.m. Friday, June 5, 2015, to file privileged reports to accompany measures making appropriations for the fiscal year ending Sept. 30, 2016.
The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 114-136, by Mr. Newhouse.
The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 114-136, by Mr. Newhouse.

summary.text: Sets forth the rule for consideration of the bill (H.R. 2289) to reauthorize the Commodity Futures Trading Commission, to better protect futures customers, to provide end-users with market certainty, to make basic reforms to ensure transparency and accountability at the Commission, to help farmers, ranchers, and end-users manage risks, to help keep consumer costs low.

bill.title: Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 2289) to reauthorize the Commodity Futures Trading Commission, to better protect futures customers, to provide end-users with market certainty, to make basic reforms to ensure transparency and accountability at the Commission, to help farmers, ranchers, and end-users manage risks, to help keep consumer costs low, and for other purposes.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
